main event: A bright, round object was sighted over Fort Benning, Georgia on January 12, 1951.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of an automobile tire and was very bright.
It was visible for about half a minute, during which time it traveled about six times its own length before disappearing completely.
The object was seen by 10 civilian witnesses and was not a weather balloon launched by the local Air Force bases.
The object appeared to be just over the treetops, which were estimated to be around 1,000 feet in altitude.
A separate report from Project Twinkle mentioned an incident involving an unidentified object, but no further details were provided.
